The Iron Path does not describe a road. It describes a decision made every moment: to choose discipline over impulse, presence over escape, clarity over comfort. Sunlee governs from this principle, and the State of Akison is shaped by it.

The State of Akison is split between two geographical environments that seem as unlike each other as possible: a dense, ancient jungle on the mainland, and a serene, architecturally precise island city that blooms from the water like a stone flower. The contrast is not accidental â€” the tension between the jungleâ€™s primordial complexity and the islandâ€™s cultivated order mirrors the doctrine of the Iron Path that governs both.

Capital: Akison Island

Akison (Island Capital) encompasses its entire island â€” every square foot has been built on and shaped. The design is based on an ancient Japanese city pattern: curved rooftops, zen courtyards, fortified bamboo walls reinforced with stone, walkways spanning water between districts. The city expands from a central palace in the pattern of five cherry blossom petals: the Five Blossom Rings (Sakura-go).

The Five Blossom Rings:

  • Tetsukaku (é‰„é–£, â€œIron Heightsâ€) â€” Government district. Home to the Iron Bloom (Sunleeâ€™s palace and Tetsugan meeting hall). Stone watchtowers, ceremonial halls.
  • Koganemura (é»„é‡‘æ‘, â€œGolden Villageâ€) â€” Martial training district: temples, dojos, tournament grounds. Annual martial festivals, public spar duels.
  • Uramizu (è£æ°´, â€œHidden Watersâ€) â€” Canal-filled black market zone. Curved alleys, shadow bridges, hidden gates. Policed unofficially by old guilds and smugglers.
  • Harashima (åŸå³¶, â€œSprawling Isleâ€) â€” Riverfront economic district: foreign embassies, trader towers, floating market barges, midnight auctions.
  • ShÅmeika (ç…§æ˜èŠ±, â€œLuminous Blossomâ€) â€” Cultural and spiritual heart: blossom-viewing temples, ink halls, ancestral gardens. Paper lanterns, spirit drums, performance arenas.

The Kurashiki Region (Northern Island Mountains) is dense with sacred shrines and cherry blossom groves. Home to powerful samurai and shinobi clans with conditional loyalty to the Iron Path.

Mainland Settlements

  • Oniofast â€” Jungle town in ancient shifting ruins. Pegasus covert operations HQ. Half-mechanical, half-organic streets. Rose, Butterfly, and all magic users banned â€” entry is suicide. Annual â€œSignal Harvestâ€ event.
  • Kusamori â€” Center of medicine, poison, and herbs. Platform-built above the forest canopy. Tram transportation.
  • Okbridge â€” Checkpoint connecting mainland to Akison island. Tight customs, engineer guilds, vehicle refit stations.
  • Neruvalis â€” â€œThe Disappearing Cityâ€ â€” built on a slope into the water, sometimes submerged by tides. Midway port to Glaril.

Government: The Iron Path

Sunlee, Master of Martial Arts, governs through personal strength, respect, and the doctrine of discipline and clarity. He never speaks more than necessary. He carries only the Black Root â€” a metalwood staff from the old jungle. No armor, no magic.

The Tetsugan (â€œIron Eye Councilâ€): 4 Kurashiki Clan Emissaries, 5 City Keepers, and 2 Tora no ShÅ«jin (â€œPrison Tigersâ€). Meets in the Iron Bloom. Sunleeâ€™s silence overrides any tie.
